comments.comment:
The following shows information about pros and cons of two parties who ruled the country in the past.
Sirimavo Bandaranayake(independent)(1972 - 1978)  First JVP insurrection(terrorism was visible)
Junius Richard Jayewardene(UNP)(1978 -1989)Second JVP insurrection started in 1987,The LTTE carried out its first major attack on 23 July 1983,(terrorism was visible)
 Ranasinghe Premadasa (1989-1993)(UNP) - many youth/civilians were killed(Both JVP and the government involved in killings)-(terrorism was visible)
Mahinda Rajapaksa (2005 - 2010)  Ended the 30-year-long  LTTE insurgency in the country(put an end to terrorism)

Mahinda Rajapaksa (2010 - 2015) - terrorism was not visible.
Maithripala Sirisena(2015 - 2019)   - (UNP backed coalition) - ISIS Attack (terrorism was visible)
As  you see the above main incidents even a child can understand when one group was ruling the country except one case the terrorism was visible and  the other group was able to conquer  the terrorism.
Therefore  the civilians should keep a big attention...it seems like a cycle is repeating from time to time.
comments.author: Lakmin Perera

comments.comment: The government did not get the public's basic needs right. Public's opinion does not necessarily base on what they request openly, especially when the public in question is lacking in critical thinking (our masses rank among the lowest IQs in Asian countries, only slightly above Nepal), but on what they "need" the most. This is not houses for the poor, or putting all criminals behind bars, or providing free internet, feminine pads, etc.. Mainly, it was about the "stability", which should be the basis for any government, and their prime strength (take any successful government in the world), even if they are weaker in every other department (such as development). Unfortunately, this governing period was infested with preventable crises, such as the petroleum crisis, power crisis, Easter attacks, dissolving the parliament, sacking the PM, debt managing crises (leasing assets to foreign entities), and many more. These battered the public and they sided with what they perceived as a "strong" leader. Please be competent next time.
comments.author: Tinkerer

comments.comment: Oh my god, please keep your mouth shut. Rubbish talks from somebody who looted and wasted a staggering amount of the tax payers' money (our money)   on those huge bill boards planted on either side of main roads and streets. People may remember what was said by late right reverend Soma Himi at his last meeting held in Kandy. He said,' Some people want me dead and walk over my dead body to ruin our country , nation and Buddhism'. Soma hamudruwo was referring to punks like Champaka who indeed entered the parliament following Soma Thero's demise under the banner of protecting Buddhism. In fact what he did was the exact opposite. If Soma Thera was alive, this fellow would have never got his foot in the door of the parliament. Mark my word, this fellow will try to cross over again but will abhorrently be rejected by Gota. Those who need more about this fellow, please watch SLVLOG by Mundungoda with whom Sajith had a conversation just before the election. I can say so much about this lout because I am one of those who voted for him after 2004. If somebody is born into a land, they should have a sense of belonging to it. It is not racism. Gota did things that we can't approve, but it is nothing compared to what this fellow (Champaka) and the UNP regime did from 2015 to 2019 Oct. I can speak about him for hours and hours, but i won't. My Comment is open to debate.
